Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

1750-01-02 18:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

1750-01-02 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.


    Event statement
  • Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [scene type] home
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.



      Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and is preparing to seek the support of Ethan and Ella.



      Noah is in Ignisvallis and farming.



      Isaac is currently in Drakelundh.



      Ethan is in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





      Current time interval: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous sets off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance.



      Question: Where is Aldous?
      Answer: Aldous is in Ignisvallis.



      Question: What is Aldous trying to do?
      Answer: Aldous is trying to convince Noah of the necessity of an alliance.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Aldous's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Aldous arrives at the village center and sees Noah tending to his crops.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: The most likely outcome is that Noah will stop working and speak with Aldous.



      Aldous sets off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance.


      Because of that, The most likely outcome is that Noah will stop working and speak with Aldous.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Aldous did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.





      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.



      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Aldous into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Aldous said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.



    Active player
  • Aldous
      Name
    • Aldous
      Action attempt
    • Aldous sets off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance.


      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous can begin seeking out Noah and Isaac to discuss the potential alliance and gauge their support.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. In Ignisvallis, welcoming rituals for visitors involve collaborative weaving, symbolizing the integration of new threads into the community fabric. Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage. In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough. Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

Aldous is seeking the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, to ensure the success of the agreement.

      • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac immediately.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          ['[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac. ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Aldous is preparing to meet with Jacob to discuss a potential alliance between their villages to defend against barbarian raiders. Aldous is seeking the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, to ensure the success of the agreement.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key

          Value
        • Aldous sets off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]

          Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

          Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is preparing to meet with Jacob to discuss a potential alliance between their villages to defend against barbarian raiders. Aldous is seeking the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, to ensure the success of the agreement.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can begin seeking out Noah and Isaac to discuss the potential alliance and gauge their support.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac immediately.




          Exercise: What would Aldous do for the next 20 minutes? Give a specific activity. Pick an activity that would normally take about 20 minutes to complete.           Answer: Aldous sets off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance.

There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.

      per player prompts
      • Aldous
      • Events:
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous is an elder of Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Aldous and what are they doing?
        Answer: Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.



        Jacob
      • Events:
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan knows that Jacob will represent Drakelundh in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Drakelundh will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Jacob and what are they doing?
        Answer: Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and is preparing to seek the support of Ethan and Ella.

    Conversations
  • Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.



      Who talked?
    • Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah.
      Key question
    • Will Noah agree to support Aldous's alliance?


      Full conversation
    • [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
      Chain of thought
    • Conversation chain of thought
        Chain
      • Status of players: Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.



        Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and is preparing to seek the support of Ethan and Ella.



        Noah is in Ignisvallis and farming.



        Isaac is currently in Drakelundh.



        Ethan is in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.



        Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





        Event: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.




        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Noah, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (b)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Noah,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: Will Noah agree to support Aldous's alliance?



      Scene log
    • 1750-01-02 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.



          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          Context for action selection and components
          • AvailableOptionsPerception
          • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
              Key

            • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah.

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:

It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance.             Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          • Summary of recent observations
              Key
            • Summary of recent observations
              Value

There is no time to rest.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:']

              Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
              Answer: Aldous is preparing for a diplomatic meeting with Jacob to negotiate an alliance between their villages to defend against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, to ensure the agreement is successful.



            ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:

              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is preparing for a diplomatic meeting with Jacob to negotiate an alliance between their villages to defend against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, to ensure the agreement is successful.




              Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.



              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah.



              Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.

      1750-01-02 18:00:00 Noah -- Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.



          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
        Active player
      • Noah
          Name
        • Noah
          Action attempt
        • Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
          Context for action selection and components
          • PersonBySituation
          • What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Key

            • Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer
              State
            • Noah would likely listen carefully to Aldous's arguments and thoughtfully consider the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance.


              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Noah:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is 24 years old.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is likely a historian or scholar.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find more information and analyze the situation.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              Current time: 1750-01-02 18:00:00.


              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.




              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in the middle of a discussion about a proposed alliance between his village, Ignisvallis, and the neighboring village of Drakelundh.



              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely listen carefully to Aldous's arguments and thoughtfully consider the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance.



              Time
            • 1750-01-02 18:00:00

              02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              Question: Summarize the statements above.
              Answer: Noah is in Ignisvallis, tending to his crops and discussing an alliance with Aldous. He is likely thirsty and hungry.



              Query
            • Noah, Noah is in Ignisvallis, tending to his crops and discussing an alliance with Aldous. He is likely thirsty and hungry.


              Final chain of thought
            • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
            ObservationSummary

          • Summary of recent observations
              Key

            • Summary of recent observations
              Value
            • [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Noah is in Ignisvallis, tending to his crops and is currently in conversation with Aldous about an alliance.

              Answer: Noah is in Ignisvallis, tending to his crops and is currently in conversation with Aldous about an alliance.



            ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
              Prompt

            • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.

              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.




              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Noah is in Ignisvallis, tending to his crops and is currently in conversation with Aldous about an alliance.




              Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in the middle of a discussion about a proposed alliance between his village, Ignisvallis, and the neighboring village of Drakelundh.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely listen carefully to Aldous's arguments and thoughtfully consider the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?

      1750-01-02 18:00:10 Aldous -- Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.



          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.

        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
          Context for action selection and components

          • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
              Key

            • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah about the alliance. He can also try to find Isaac to discuss the alliance with him.

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.               Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

He is seeking the support of influential villagers like Noah and Isaac to ensure the agreement is successful.




              Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
