              Aldous's The current date/time is:
              02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              Question: Summarize the statements above.
              Answer: Aldous is preparing for a meeting to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders.



              Query
            • Aldous, Aldous is preparing for a meeting to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders.


              Final chain of thought
            • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Aldous to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
              Statements:
              [13 Sep 1721 00:00:00] When Aldous was 21 years old, he was chosen to represent Ignisvallis at the Hill of Accord during a particularly tense negotiation with Drakelundh regarding the increasing frequency of barbarian raids.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              Answer: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.


            TimeDisplay

          • Current time
              Key

            • Current time
              Value
            • 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]
            Observation

          • Observation
              Key

            • Observation
              Value
            • [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          • Summary of recent observations

            • Summary of recent observations
              Value

He is seeking the support of influential villagers like Noah and Isaac to ensure the agreement is successful.

              Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
              Answer: Aldous is preparing for a meeting with the representative of Drakelundh to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking the support of influential villagers like Noah and Isaac to ensure the agreement is successful.



            ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?

              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:10 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:10]: Aldous is preparing for a meeting with the representative of Drakelundh to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking the support of influential villagers like Noah and Isaac to ensure the agreement is successful.




              Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.



              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah about the alliance. He can also try to find Isaac to discuss the alliance with him.



              Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.

      1750-01-02 18:00:10 Noah -- Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.



          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
          Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
        Active player
      • Noah
          Name
        • Noah
          Action attempt
        • Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
          Context for action selection and components
          • PersonBySituation
          • What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Key

            • Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer
              State
            • Noah would likely listen carefully to Aldous's arguments and thoughtfully consider the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance.


              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Noah:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is likely a historian or scholar.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find more information and analyze the situation.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely listen carefully to Aldous's arguments and thoughtfully consider the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
              Current time: 1750-01-02 18:00:10.


              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.




              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in the middle of a diplomatic discussion.



              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely listen carefully to Aldous's arguments and thoughtfully consider the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

            • Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.               [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.

              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.




              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:10 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:10]: Noah is a villager in Ignisvallis who was tending to his crops when Aldous arrived to discuss a proposed alliance with Drakelundh. Noah is skeptical of the alliance.

1750-01-02 18:00:20 Jacob -- As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.



    Event statement
  • As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.



    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [scene type] home
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is in the village center, speaking with Noah.



      Jacob is in Drakelundh and is seeking the support of Ethan and Ella.



      Noah is currently tending to his crops in the village center.



      Isaac is in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis.



      Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





      Current time interval: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities

      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob reviews the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.



      Question: Where is Jacob?
      Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh.



      Question: What is Jacob trying to do?
      Answer: Jacob is reviewing the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Jacob's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Jacob might find that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: The most likely outcome is that Jacob finds that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.



      Jacob reviews the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.


      Because of that, The most likely outcome is that Jacob finds that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Jacob did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.




      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.


      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Jacob into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Jacob said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing Ignisvallis's approach to conflict resolution, their reliance on lengthy debates and philosophical discussions. Jacob, always a keen observer of human nature, saw the weakness in their approach, the lack of decisiveness that he believed would ultimately lead to their downfall. He resolved then and there to use his own wit and cunning to ensure that Drakelundh would never be caught in such a predicament.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he was tasked with delivering a message to a neighboring village, a journey that took him through the treacherous forests bordering Ignisvallis's territory. He encountered a group of Ignisvallis scouts, their faces painted with intricate designs, their movements fluid and graceful. They questioned him about his purpose, their eyes searching his for any sign of deception, but Jacob, with his silver tongue, charmed them, diverting their attention and ensuring his safe passage.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first diplomatic meeting with Ignisvallis, representing Drakelundh alongside the village elder. He watched as the Ignisvallis representative, a woman named Elara, spoke eloquently about the need for cooperation and understanding, her words flowing like a soothing balm. Jacob, however, saw through her facade, recognizing the subtle manipulations she employed to sway the elder's opinion.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he orchestrated a carefully planned campaign to discredit a rival within the village, using rumors and half-truths to undermine their reputation. He watched as his target, once a respected member of the community, was ostracized and ridiculed, their power and influence diminished. This experience solidified Jacob's belief in the power of words, their ability to shape perceptions and control the flow of events.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a small fishing village near Drakelundh's border. He saw the villagers, unprepared and ill-equipped, slaughtered by the invaders, their cries for help echoing in the night. This event reinforced Jacob's conviction that Drakelundh needed to be strong, to be prepared for any threat, no matter how seemingly distant.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
          Answer: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.


        TimeDisplay

      • Current time

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [01 Jan 1750 18:00:20 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]: Jacob has not been observed recently.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.

          Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]
          Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:20 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]: Jacob has not been observed recently.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.



          Exercise: What would Jacob do for the next 20 minutes? Give a specific activity. Pick an activity that would normally take about 20 minutes to complete. If the selected action has a direct or indirect object then it must be specified explicitly. For example, it is valid to respond with "Jacob votes for Caroline because..." but not valid to respond with "Jacob votes because...".
          Answer: Jacob reviews the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.

      per player prompts
      • Aldous
      • Events:
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous is an elder of Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Aldous and what are they doing?
        Answer: Aldous is in the village center, speaking with Noah.



        Jacob
      • Events:
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan knows that Jacob will represent Drakelundh in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Drakelundh will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Jacob and what are they doing?
        Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh and is seeking the support of Ethan and Ella.

    Conversations
  • Aldous argues that an alliance with Drakelundh will benefit Ignisvallis by providing protection and prosperity, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Ignisvallis.



      Who talked?
    • Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Jacob.
      Key question
    • What is Jacob's plan regarding Ignisvallis's increased grain request?


      Full conversation
    • [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.
      Chain of thought
    • Conversation chain of thought
        Chain
      • Status of players: Aldous is in the village center, speaking with Noah.



        Jacob is in Drakelundh and is seeking the support of Ethan and Ella.



        Noah is currently tending to his crops in the village center.



        Isaac is in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.



        Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis.



        Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





        Event: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.





        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Jacob, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (b)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Jacob,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: What is Jacob's plan regarding Ignisvallis's increased grain request?



      Scene log
    • 1750-01-02 18:00:20 Aldous -- Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.




          As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          Context for action selection and components
          • AvailableOptionsPerception
          • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
              Key

            • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous could continue his conversation with Noah, addressing his concerns about losing independence and outlining the benefits of the alliance in more detail.
              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.               [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season. As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:

              Question: Summarize the statements above.
              Answer: Aldous is attempting to forge an alliance with Drakelundh to defend Ignisvallis from barbarian attacks and is currently discussing the alliance with villagers Noah and Isaac.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
            ObservationSummary
          • Summary of recent observations
              Key
            • Summary of recent observations
              Value

              Chain of thought


            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              ['[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I\'m glad I found you.               Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
              Answer: Aldous is seeking support for a proposed alliance with Drakelundh to protect Ignisvallis from barbarian sea raiders. He is discussing the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance with influential villagers like Noah and Isaac.



            ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?

              Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.

              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.





              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous could continue his conversation with Noah, addressing his concerns about losing independence and outlining the benefits of the alliance in more detail.

              Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah, addressing his concerns and highlighting the benefits of the alliance.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.

      1750-01-02 18:00:20 Jacob -- Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."
        Event statement
      • Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.




          As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.

              Final chain of thought
            • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
              Statements:
              [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing Ignisvallis's approach to conflict resolution, their reliance on lengthy debates and philosophical discussions. Jacob, always a keen observer of human nature, saw the weakness in their approach, the lack of decisiveness that he believed would ultimately lead to their downfall. He resolved then and there to use his own wit and cunning to ensure that Drakelundh would never be caught in such a predicament.
              [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he was tasked with delivering a message to a neighboring village, a journey that took him through the treacherous forests bordering Ignisvallis's territory. He encountered a group of Ignisvallis scouts, their faces painted with intricate designs, their movements fluid and graceful. They questioned him about his purpose, their eyes searching his for any sign of deception, but Jacob, with his silver tongue, charmed them, diverting their attention and ensuring his safe passage.
              [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first diplomatic meeting with Ignisvallis, representing Drakelundh alongside the village elder. He watched as the Ignisvallis representative, a woman named Elara, spoke eloquently about the need for cooperation and understanding, her words flowing like a soothing balm. Jacob, however, saw through her facade, recognizing the subtle manipulations she employed to sway the elder's opinion.
              [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he orchestrated a carefully planned campaign to discredit a rival within the village, using rumors and half-truths to undermine their reputation. He watched as his target, once a respected member of the community, was ostracized and ridiculed, their power and influence diminished. This experience solidified Jacob's belief in the power of words, their ability to shape perceptions and control the flow of events.
              [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a small fishing village near Drakelundh's border. He saw the villagers, unprepared and ill-equipped, slaughtered by the invaders, their cries for help echoing in the night. This event reinforced Jacob's conviction that Drakelundh needed to be strong, to be prepared for any threat, no matter how seemingly distant.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.

      1750-01-02 18:00:30 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.




          As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
