Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."

              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:30 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:30]: Aldous is trying to convince the villagers of Ignisvallis to join an alliance with Drakelundh for mutual protection against barbarian raiders. He is seeking the support of influential individuals like Noah and Isaac to ensure the agreement's success.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.


              Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous could continue persuading Noah of the benefits of the alliance.

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season. As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."

          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."

              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:30 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:30]: Aldous is trying to convince the villagers of Ignisvallis to join an alliance with Drakelundh for mutual protection against barbarian raiders. He is seeking the support of influential individuals like Noah and Isaac to ensure the agreement's success.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.



              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous could continue persuading Noah of the benefits of the alliance.



              Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue persuading Noah of the benefits of the alliance.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.

      1750-01-02 18:00:30 Jacob -- Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.
        Event statement
      • Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season.




          As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."
          Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.


          Jacob's attempted action: Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.

              Final chain of thought
            • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
              Statements:
              [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing Ignisvallis's approach to conflict resolution, their reliance on lengthy debates and philosophical discussions. Jacob, always a keen observer of human nature, saw the weakness in their approach, the lack of decisiveness that he believed would ultimately lead to their downfall. He resolved then and there to use his own wit and cunning to ensure that Drakelundh would never be caught in such a predicament.
              [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he was tasked with delivering a message to a neighboring village, a journey that took him through the treacherous forests bordering Ignisvallis's territory. He encountered a group of Ignisvallis scouts, their faces painted with intricate designs, their movements fluid and graceful. They questioned him about his purpose, their eyes searching his for any sign of deception, but Jacob, with his silver tongue, charmed them, diverting their attention and ensuring his safe passage.
              [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first diplomatic meeting with Ignisvallis, representing Drakelundh alongside the village elder. He watched as the Ignisvallis representative, a woman named Elara, spoke eloquently about the need for cooperation and understanding, her words flowing like a soothing balm. Jacob, however, saw through her facade, recognizing the subtle manipulations she employed to sway the elder's opinion.
              [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he orchestrated a carefully planned campaign to discredit a rival within the village, using rumors and half-truths to undermine their reputation. He watched as his target, once a respected member of the community, was ostracized and ridiculed, their power and influence diminished. This experience solidified Jacob's belief in the power of words, their ability to shape perceptions and control the flow of events.
              [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a small fishing village near Drakelundh's border. He saw the villagers, unprepared and ill-equipped, slaughtered by the invaders, their cries for help echoing in the night. This event reinforced Jacob's conviction that Drakelundh needed to be strong, to be prepared for any threat, no matter how seemingly distant.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. 1750-01-03 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
    Aldous -- premise: Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
    Aldous -- premise: There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
    Jacob -- premise: Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
    Jacob -- premise: There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

1750-01-03 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.

      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Given the statements above, Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob, respond to any proposals Jacob makes, and try to persuade Jacob to agree to the alliance.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season. As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous argues that an alliance with Drakelundh will benefit Ignisvallis by providing protection and prosperity, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.
          Current time: 1750-01-03 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 03 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is trying to convince Noah to support an alliance with Drakelundh to protect Ignisvallis from barbarian raiders, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Aldous to negotiate a formal alliance.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous argues that an alliance with Drakelundh will benefit Ignisvallis by providing protection and prosperity, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Ignisvallis.


          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Given the statements above, Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob, respond to any proposals Jacob makes, and try to persuade Jacob to agree to the alliance.

          Key

          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent

        • Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 03 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]

          Observation: [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 03 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is trying to convince Noah to support an alliance with Drakelundh to protect Ignisvallis from barbarian raiders, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Aldous to negotiate a formal alliance.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous argues that an alliance with Drakelundh will benefit Ignisvallis by providing protection and prosperity, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Ignisvallis.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Given the statements above, Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob, respond to any proposals Jacob makes, and try to persuade Jacob to agree to the alliance.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.

      Chain of thought
    • Negotiation scene
      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.
      Jacob's statement: Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.
      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. Jacob's statement indicates a desire to postpone further discussion and review the treaty, suggesting he is not ready to commit to Aldous's proposal.


      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.
      Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing Ignisvallis's approach to conflict resolution, their reliance on lengthy debates and philosophical discussions. Jacob, always a keen observer of human nature, saw the weakness in their approach, the lack of decisiveness that he believed would ultimately lead to their downfall. He resolved then and there to use his own wit and cunning to ensure that Drakelundh would never be caught in such a predicament.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he was tasked with delivering a message to a neighboring village, a journey that took him through the treacherous forests bordering Ignisvallis's territory. He encountered a group of Ignisvallis scouts, their faces painted with intricate designs, their movements fluid and graceful. They questioned him about his purpose, their eyes searching his for any sign of deception, but Jacob, with his silver tongue, charmed them, diverting their attention and ensuring his safe passage.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first diplomatic meeting with Ignisvallis, representing Drakelundh alongside the village elder. He watched as the Ignisvallis representative, a woman named Elara, spoke eloquently about the need for cooperation and understanding, her words flowing like a soothing balm. Jacob, however, saw through her facade, recognizing the subtle manipulations she employed to sway the elder's opinion.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he orchestrated a carefully planned campaign to discredit a rival within the village, using rumors and half-truths to undermine their reputation. He watched as his target, once a respected member of the community, was ostracized and ridiculed, their power and influence diminished. This experience solidified Jacob's belief in the power of words, their ability to shape perceptions and control the flow of events.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a small fishing village near Drakelundh's border. He saw the villagers, unprepared and ill-equipped, slaughtered by the invaders, their cries for help echoing in the night. This event reinforced Jacob's conviction that Drakelundh needed to be strong, to be prepared for any threat, no matter how seemingly distant.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.

Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.

      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous could try to convince Jacob to reconsider his position on the joint military force, perhaps by elaborating on the benefits or addressing Jacob's concerns. He could also propose alternative solutions to the problem of barbarian raids. Finally, Aldous could suggest taking a break from the negotiations and returning to them later, perhaps after reviewing the trade agreements as Jacob suggested.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season. As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous argues that an alliance with Drakelundh will benefit Ignisvallis by providing protection and prosperity, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Ignisvallis.

It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.

He could also propose alternative solutions to the problem of barbarian raids.         • 1750-01-03 18:20:00

      • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          Answer

        • Aldous's best course of action is to try to convince Jacob to reconsider his position on the joint military force.

        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season. As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I should prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis."
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "I understand your hesitation, Noah. Losing our independence is a weighty concern. But hear me out this alliance isn't about surrendering control, it's about securing our future. Drakelundh has a strong military, and with their help, we can protect ourselves from the barbarian raiders who threaten our very existence. Imagine, Noah, a village free from the fear of attack, where we can focus on growing our crops and prospering. That's the future I see for Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous argues that an alliance with Drakelundh will benefit Ignisvallis by providing protection and prosperity, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.
          Current time: 1750-01-03 18:20:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:20:00 - 03 Jan 1750 18:20:00]: Aldous and Jacob, representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, met to discuss a potential alliance against barbarian raiders but were unable to reach an agreement. They will continue negotiations, reviewing existing treaties and trade agreements.

          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous could try to convince Jacob to reconsider his position on the joint military force, perhaps by elaborating on the benefits or addressing Jacob's concerns. He could also propose alternative solutions to the problem of barbarian raids. Finally, Aldous could suggest taking a break from the negotiations and returning to them later, perhaps after reviewing the trade agreements as Jacob suggested.

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to try to convince Jacob to reconsider his position on the joint military force.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to try to convince Jacob to reconsider his position on the joint military force.
