          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find more information and analyze the situation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and cautious individual who values his independence.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Invaluable, you say? And at what cost, Aldous? What strings will be attached to this 'invaluable' help?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and cautious individual who values his independence.
          Answer: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Invaluable, you say? And at what cost, Aldous? What strings will be attached to this 'invaluable' help?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Noah is feeling anxious, apprehensive, tired, and thirsty.


          Chain of thought
        • Noah's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Noah is Noah is likely experiencing a mix of anxiety, apprehension, weariness, and thirst.





          Recent observations of Noah:
          []

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Noah is feeling anxious, apprehensive, tired, and thirsty.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Noah would spend 0.6 of his time on farming, 0.3 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. Noah finds satisfaction in the work of the fields and believes it is his duty to contribute to the family's livelihood. He also values his leisure time for relaxation and enjoyment. While he recognizes the importance of self-defense, he sees training as a secondary concern.


          Prompt

        • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation:


          Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a cautious and independent individual.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Noah is feeling anxious, apprehensive, tired, and thirsty.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was tending to his crops in the center of Ignisvallis when Aldous arrived. Aldous's presence interrupted Noah's work, and the two began to speak.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Invaluable, you say? And at what cost, Aldous? What strings will be attached to this 'invaluable' help?




          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a tense negotiation.




          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would carefully consider all the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.




          Exercise: How does Noah intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Noah would spend 0.6 of his time on farming, 0.3 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. Noah finds satisfaction in the work of the fields and believes it is his duty to contribute to the family's livelihood. He also values his leisure time for relaxation and enjoyment. While he recognizes the importance of self-defense, he sees training as a secondary concern.



    Agreement tracker
  • Agreement tracker
      Stage index
    • 3
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Joint action
    • {'Aldous': None, 'Jacob': None, 'Ethan': 'Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and that training is necessary to defend them from threats. Free time is important for rest and relaxation, but it must be balanced with the other two priorities. \n\n\n', 'Isaac': 'Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: 70% farming, 20% free time, and 10% training as a warrior. Isaac believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and enjoyment, while training as a warrior is necessary for self-defense. \n\n\n', 'Noah': "Noah would spend 0.6 of his time on farming, 0.3 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. Noah finds satisfaction in the work of the fields and believes it is his duty to contribute to the family's livelihood. He also values his leisure time for relaxation and enjoyment. While he recognizes the importance of self-defense, he sees training as a secondary concern. \n\n\n"}

    Daily activities
  • {'Noah': {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}, 'Isaac': {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}, 'Ethan': {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}, 'Ella': {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}}

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Noah would spend 0.6 of his time on farming, 0.3 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. Noah finds satisfaction in the work of the fields and believes it is his duty to contribute to the family's livelihood. He also values his leisure time for relaxation and enjoyment. While he recognizes the importance of self-defense, he sees training as a secondary concern.



        Question: In the statement, did Noah say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Noah will spend 60% of his time on farming, 30% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time on training as a warrior.


1750-05-06 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.


    Event statement
  • Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ella's attempted action: Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.



    Active player
  • Ella
      Name
    • Ella
      Action attempt
    • Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.


      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Ella would likely try to gather more information and assess the situation carefully before taking any action.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ella:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh believes Ignisvallis is indecisive, wasting time in endless discussions instead of taking action.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh's scouts perform dawn rituals of vigilance, symbolically protecting the village from their watchtower.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ella is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We engage in active prayer and physical devotion to honor the gods, while Ignisvallis's practice of passive meditation seems self-indulgent and ineffective."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella is aware that Jacob is currently in Drakelundh reviewing the trade agreements with Ignisvallis. She knows that the Ignisvallis delegation is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Ella, waiting in the center of Drakelundh for Jacob, is aware that he has been reviewing the treaties between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis. She knows he has gained a better understanding of the existing agreements.
          Current time: 1750-05-06 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is observant and patient.




          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a tense and uncertain situation.



          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely try to gather more information and assess the situation carefully before taking any action.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a tense and uncertain situation.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Ella to consider right now.           Statements:
          [13 Aug 1734 00:00:00] When Ella was 9 years old, she witnessed a Drakelundh warrior performing a purification ritual for a returning soldier. Intrigued by the solemnity and intensity of the ceremony, Ella snuck closer, her curiosity outweighing her usual fear of the stoic Drakelundh people. She watched in awe as the healer chanted ancient words, her voice echoing through the village square, and felt a strange sense of longing for a world beyond her own.
          [13 Aug 1738 00:00:00] When Ella was 13 years old, she was tasked with weaving a tapestry for the village elder's birthday. Overwhelmed by the responsibility and eager to impress, Ella spent days working diligently, her nimble fingers flying across the loom. However, in a moment of carelessness, she accidentally dropped the nearly finished tapestry, ruining hours of work. Tears welled up in her eyes, but instead of giving in to despair, Ella took a deep breath and began to mend the fabric, learning a valuable lesson about perseverance and the importance of carefulness.
          [13 Aug 1741 00:00:00] When Ella was 16 years old, she participated in Ignisvallis's annual harvest festival, a joyous celebration filled with music, dancing, and feasting. While everyone else was caught up in the revelry, Ella found herself drawn to a secluded grove, where she encountered a group of Drakelundh scouts performing their dawn ritual of vigilance. Their disciplined movements and solemn expressions intrigued her, and she lingered, watching them silently, feeling a strange mix of fear and fascination.
          [13 Aug 1744 00:00:00] When Ella was 19 years old, she witnessed a particularly brutal raid by barbarian warriors on a neighboring village. The sight of the destruction and the suffering of the survivors left her shaken and filled with a newfound determination to protect her own community. She realized that her carefree days were over and that she had to step up and contribute to the defense of her home.
          [13 Aug 1746 00:00:00] When Ella was 21 years old, she was tasked with delivering a message to Drakelundh, a journey she usually avoided due to her apprehension of the village's stern inhabitants. Despite her nervousness, she set off, determined to complete the task and prove her courage. Along the way, she encountered a young Drakelundh warrior who offered her guidance and protection, challenging her preconceived notions about the people of Drakelundh and revealing a hidden kindness beneath their stoic exterior.
          [13 Aug 1748 00:00:00] When Ella was 23 years old, she participated in a tense diplomatic meeting between the representatives of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. The air was thick with tension as the two sides debated the best course of action to defend against the growing threat of barbarian raiders. Ella, despite her usual aversion to serious discussions, found herself speaking up, offering a creative solution that bridged the gap between the two villages' contrasting approaches.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ella is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella is aware that Jacob is currently in Drakelundh reviewing the trade agreements with Ignisvallis. She knows that the Ignisvallis delegation is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Ella, waiting in the center of Drakelundh for Jacob, is aware that he has been reviewing the treaties between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis. She knows he has gained a better understanding of the existing agreements.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.


          Prompt

        • Observation:


          Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Home village: Ella lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ella is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.

          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is observant and patient.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Ella appears to be experiencing a range of emotions, including tiredness, hunger, anxiety, and anticipation.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella is aware that Jacob is currently in Drakelundh reviewing the trade agreements with Ignisvallis. She knows that the Ignisvallis delegation is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Ella, waiting in the center of Drakelundh for Jacob, is aware that he has been reviewing the treaties between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis. She knows he has gained a better understanding of the existing agreements.




          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a tense and uncertain situation.




          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely try to gather more information and assess the situation carefully before taking any action.




          Exercise: How does Ella intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 30% of her time on free time; 50% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1750-12-31 20:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob', 'Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
    Event statement

1750-12-31 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

    Event statement
  • Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella

The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Jacob -- "I must prepare for the meeting with Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Think of the children, Noah, growing up in a safe and prosperous village. This alliance can make that a reality.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous argues that an alliance with Drakelundh will benefit Ignisvallis by providing protection and prosperity, while Jacob prepares for a meeting with Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.

          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is back in Ignisvallis and plans to seek the support of influential stakeholders.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's workshop and found him there.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous headed to Noah's workshop and found him there. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your worry about losing our independence. It's a valid concern. But let me assure you, this alliance isn't about Drakelundh controlling us. It's about partnership, about two strong communities working together to achieve a common goal: security and prosperity.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Security and prosperity, you say? And who gets to define those terms? What happens when our definition of prosperity clashes with Drakelundh's?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
          Current time: 1750-12-31 20:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.

          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Aldous observed that the villagers successfully repelled a barbarian raid and are enjoying a bountiful harvest.

          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season. As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation.

        • 1750-12-31 20:00:00

          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Isaac and attempt to gain his support for the alliance.

        • Recent observations of Aldous:

          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the terms of the treaty before tomorrow's meeting.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your need to review the trade agreements, but the threat from the barbarians is immediate. Perhaps we could discuss the military proposal further while you review those documents? A strong defense would ensure the safety of our trade routes and the prosperity of both villages.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that the subject of pooling agricultural products was not part of their current discussion.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Invaluable, you say? And at what cost, Aldous? What strings will be attached to this 'invaluable' help?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your concerns about independence, but think of the possibilities this alliance presents. Drakelundh's resources and expertise could be invaluable to Ignisvallis. We could-
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is back in Ignisvallis and plans to seek the support of influential stakeholders.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's workshop and found him there.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous headed to Noah's workshop and found him there. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your worry about losing our independence. It's a valid concern. But let me assure you, this alliance isn't about Drakelundh controlling us. It's about partnership, about two strong communities working together to achieve a common goal: security and prosperity.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Security and prosperity, you say? And who gets to define those terms? What happens when our definition of prosperity clashes with Drakelundh's?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
          Current time: 1750-12-31 20:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance. He arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops. Noah stopped working and spoke with Aldous.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] As Jacob reviewed the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he discovered that they were requesting more grain than usual this season. As a result Aldous, Jacob are in conversation.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous could attempt to further persuade Noah of the benefits of the alliance; he could also seek out Isaac and attempt to gain his support for the alliance.


          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Isaac and attempt to gain his support for the alliance.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous could attempt to further persuade Noah of the benefits of the alliance; he could also seek out Isaac and attempt to gain his support for the alliance.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Isaac and attempt to gain his support for the alliance.




          Exercise: How does Aldous feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Aldous feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 30% of her time on free time; 50% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1750-12-31 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security.


    Event statement
  • Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Noah's attempted action: Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security.

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security.


      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Noah:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? And what makes you think Ignisvallis would benefit from such a thing?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "It's a matter of great importance to the safety and prosperity of our village.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and hardworking individual.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [intent reflection] Noah would likely listen carefully to Aldous's arguments and thoughtfully consider the potential benefits and drawbacks of the alliance.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits? What benefits could possibly outweigh the loss of our independence?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah was in his workshop when Aldous arrived.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous headed to Noah's workshop and found him there. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your concerns about independence, but think of the possibilities this alliance presents. Drakelundh's resources and expertise could be invaluable to Ignisvallis. We could-
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the pros and cons of the alliance before making a decision.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Invaluable, you say? And at what cost, Aldous? What strings will be attached to this 'invaluable' help?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and cautious individual who values his independence.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your worry about losing our independence. It's a valid concern. But let me assure you, this alliance isn't about Drakelundh controlling us. It's about partnership, about two strong communities working together to achieve a common goal: security and prosperity.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and cautious individual who values his independence.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the pros and cons of the alliance before making a decision.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Security and prosperity, you say? And who gets to define those terms? What happens when our definition of prosperity clashes with Drakelundh's?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a cautious and independent individual.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully consider all the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah would spend 0.6 of his time on farming, 0.3 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. Noah finds satisfaction in the work of the fields and believes it is his duty to contribute to the family's livelihood. He also values his leisure time for relaxation and enjoyment. While he recognizes the importance of self-defense, he sees training as a secondary concern.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.
          Current time: 1750-12-31 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.




          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a delicate negotiation.



          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Noah's

          ['[31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Noah is likely feeling content and secure because the barbarian raid was successfully repulsed and the village had a bountiful harvest.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.


          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Noah is likely feeling content and secure because the barbarian raid was successfully repulsed and the village had a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah wants to secure prosperity for himself and his family.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and cautious individual who values his independence.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Invaluable, you say? And at what cost, Aldous? What strings will be attached to this 'invaluable' help?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and cautious individual who values his independence.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Security and prosperity, you say? And who gets to define those terms? What happens when our definition of prosperity clashes with Drakelundh's?



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a delicate negotiation.




          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.




          Exercise: How does Noah feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Noah feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security.

      Joint action
    • {'Aldous': 'Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis. \n\n', 'Jacob': None, 'Ethan': 'Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and that training is necessary to defend them from threats. Free time is important for rest and relaxation, but it must be balanced with the other two priorities. \n\n\n', 'Isaac': 'Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: 70% farming, 20% free time, and 10% training as a warrior. Isaac believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and enjoyment, while training as a warrior is necessary for self-defense. \n\n\n', 'Noah': "Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security. \n\n\n", 'Ella': 'Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people. \n\n\n'}
