      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time training as a warrior.



1751-12-31 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year went. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.


    Event statement
  • Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year went. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year went. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.



    Active player
  • Aldous
      Name
    • Aldous
      Action attempt
    • Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year went. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.


      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous could try to convince Noah and Isaac to support an alliance with Drakelundh.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Security and prosperity, you say? And who gets to define those terms? What happens when our definition of prosperity clashes with Drakelundh's?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your worry about losing our independence. It's a valid concern. But let me assure you, this alliance isn't about Drakelundh controlling us. It's about partnership, about two strong communities working together to achieve a common goal: security and prosperity.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the terms of the last agreement with Ignisvallis."
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, while I understand the need to review past agreements, the safety of our people is paramount. Let us discuss a concrete plan for mutual defense. Perhaps we could start with a shared patrol schedule along the border, allowing us to better anticipate and respond to barbarian threats.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that there is no such agreement in place.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "As I was saying, Noah, the alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village. Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests. Imagine the possibilities for trade, for sharing knowledge and skills that would benefit everyone.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Improved defenses, you say? And what makes you think Drakelundh wouldn't simply turn on us once they've secured our resources?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, highlighting potential benefits like improved defenses and trade, while Noah expresses skepticism about Drakelundh's intentions.
          [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
          Current time: 1751-12-31 20:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.

          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Aldous witnessed a successful defense against barbarian invaders and a bountiful harvest celebrated by the villagers.




          Recalled memories and observations: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.


          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous could try to convince Noah and Isaac to support an alliance with Drakelundh.

        • 1751-12-31 20:00:00
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to try to convince Noah and Isaac to support an alliance with Drakelundh.

The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.

          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.           [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "As I was saying, Noah, the alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.           [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Improved defenses, you say? And what makes you think Drakelundh wouldn't simply turn on us once they've secured our resources?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, highlighting potential benefits like improved defenses and trade, while Noah expresses skepticism about Drakelundh's intentions.
          [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.

He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time training as a warrior.



1751-12-31 20:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob felt that this year was a mixed bag. The diplomatic talks with Ignisvallis were a success, and he was proud of how he represented Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. However, he was concerned about the growing tensions between the two villages, and he worried that a conflict could erupt if things didn't improve. Jacob hoped that next year would bring more cooperation and understanding between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.


    Event statement
  • Jacob felt that this year was a mixed bag. The diplomatic talks with Ignisvallis were a success, and he was proud of how he represented Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. However, he was concerned about the growing tensions between the two villages, and he worried that a conflict could erupt if things didn't improve. Jacob hoped that next year would bring more cooperation and understanding between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous

      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella

The diplomatic talks with Ignisvallis were a success, and he was proud of how he represented Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. However, he was concerned about the growing tensions between the two villages, and he worried that a conflict could erupt if things didn't improve. Jacob hoped that next year would bring more cooperation and understanding between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

Jacob hoped that next year would bring more cooperation and understanding between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing Ignisvallis's approach to conflict resolution, their reliance on lengthy debates and philosophical discussions. Jacob, always a keen observer of human nature, saw the weakness in their approach, the lack of decisiveness that he believed would ultimately lead to their downfall. He resolved then and there to use his own wit and cunning to ensure that Drakelundh would never be caught in such a predicament.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he was tasked with delivering a message to a neighboring village, a journey that took him through the treacherous forests bordering Ignisvallis's territory. He encountered a group of Ignisvallis scouts, their faces painted with intricate designs, their movements fluid and graceful. They questioned him about his purpose, their eyes searching his for any sign of deception, but Jacob, with his silver tongue, charmed them, diverting their attention and ensuring his safe passage.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first diplomatic meeting with Ignisvallis, representing Drakelundh alongside the village elder. He watched as the Ignisvallis representative, a woman named Elara, spoke eloquently about the need for cooperation and understanding, her words flowing like a soothing balm. Jacob, however, saw through her facade, recognizing the subtle manipulations she employed to sway the elder's opinion.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he orchestrated a carefully planned campaign to discredit a rival within the village, using rumors and half-truths to undermine their reputation. He watched as his target, once a respected member of the community, was ostracized and ridiculed, their power and influence diminished. This experience solidified Jacob's belief in the power of words, their ability to shape perceptions and control the flow of events.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a small fishing village near Drakelundh's border. He saw the villagers, unprepared and ill-equipped, slaughtered by the invaders, their cries for help echoing in the night. This event reinforced Jacob's conviction that Drakelundh needed to be strong, to be prepared for any threat, no matter how seemingly distant.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
          Answer: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob felt that this year was a mixed bag. The diplomatic talks with Ignisvallis were a success, and he was proud of how he represented Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. However, he was concerned about the growing tensions between the two villages, and he worried that a conflict could erupt if things didn't improve. Jacob hoped that next year would bring more cooperation and understanding between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Jacob has not been observed recently.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.



          Exercise: How does Jacob feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Jacob feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Jacob felt that this year was a mixed bag. The diplomatic talks with Ignisvallis were a success, and he was proud of how he represented Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. However, he was concerned about the growing tensions between the two villages, and he worried that a conflict could erupt if things didn't improve. Jacob hoped that next year would bring more cooperation and understanding between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

      Joint action
    • {'Aldous': 'Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year went. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis. \n\n\n', 'Jacob': "Jacob felt that this year was a mixed bag. The diplomatic talks with Ignisvallis were a success, and he was proud of how he represented Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. However, he was concerned about the growing tensions between the two villages, and he worried that a conflict could erupt if things didn't improve. Jacob hoped that next year would bring more cooperation and understanding between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis. \n\n\n", 'Ella': 'Ella is content with the successful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarians, but she believes the village could be more prepared for future threats. \n\n\n', 'Noah': 'Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood. \n\n\n', 'Ethan': "Ethan feels proud of the village's resilience and unity in the face of the barbarian threat. He believes their successful defense and bountiful harvest are testaments to their strength and cooperation. However, he also recognizes the need to improve their defenses and work towards a more secure future. Ethan strongly advocates for increased training and possibly forming an alliance with neighboring villages to bolster their collective strength. \n\n\n\n", 'Isaac': 'Isaac thinks this year was a good one; the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled. \n\n\n'}

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time training as a warrior.



1751-12-31 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah is pleased with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest, but he worries about the lack of a treaty with Drakelundh and the potential for future threats. He believes that the village should focus on strengthening its defenses and exploring ways to improve trade relations with neighboring villages.


    Event statement
  • Noah is pleased with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest, but he worries about the lack of a treaty with Drakelundh and the potential for future threats. He believes that the village should focus on strengthening its defenses and exploring ways to improve trade relations with neighboring villages.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Noah's attempted action: Noah is pleased with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest, but he worries about the lack of a treaty with Drakelundh and the potential for future threats. He believes that the village should focus on strengthening its defenses and exploring ways to improve trade relations with neighboring villages.

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Noah is pleased with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest, but he worries about the lack of a treaty with Drakelundh and the potential for future threats. He believes that the village should focus on strengthening its defenses and exploring ways to improve trade relations with neighboring villages.


      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Noah:
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a cautious and independent individual.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah would spend 0.6 of his time on farming, 0.3 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. Noah finds satisfaction in the work of the fields and believes it is his duty to contribute to the family's livelihood. He also values his leisure time for relaxation and enjoyment. While he recognizes the importance of self-defense, he sees training as a secondary concern.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully consider all the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is pleased with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid, but he would like to see a more formalized system of shared resources to ensure the village's long-term security.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah patiently waits in the center of Ignisvallis, anticipating Aldous' arrival. He is aware that Aldous is preparing a speech for him and Isaac, though he doesn't know the specifics of its content.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully consider all the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Improved defenses, you say? And what makes you think Drakelundh wouldn't simply turn on us once they've secured our resources?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "As I was saying, Noah, the alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village. Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests. Imagine the possibilities for trade, for sharing knowledge and skills that would benefit everyone.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, highlighting potential benefits like improved defenses and trade, while Noah expresses skepticism about Drakelundh's intentions.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a cautious and independent thinker.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood.
          [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.
          Current time: 1751-12-31 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a cautious, independent, and thoughtful individual.




          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a situation of cautious optimism.

          Answer: Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.

          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Improved defenses, you say? And what makes you think Drakelundh wouldn't simply turn on us once they've secured our resources?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "As I was saying, Noah, the alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village. Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests.           [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.

          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, highlighting potential benefits like improved defenses and trade, while Noah expresses skepticism about Drakelundh's intentions.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a cautious and independent thinker.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.           [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt

        • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a cautious, independent, and thoughtful individual.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is likely feeling optimistic because his village successfully defended against a barbarian attack and had a bountiful harvest.

Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests. Imagine the possibilities for trade, for sharing knowledge and skills that would benefit everyone.



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a situation of cautious optimism.




          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.




          Exercise: How does Noah feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Noah feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Noah is pleased with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest, but he worries about the lack of a treaty with Drakelundh and the potential for future threats. He believes that the village should focus on strengthening its defenses and exploring ways to improve trade relations with neighboring villages.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time training as a warrior.



1750-01-02 18:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

1750-01-02 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.


    Event statement
  • Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.

      Status of players: Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.



      Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and is preparing to seek the support of Ethan and Ella.



      Noah is in Ignisvallis and farming.



      Isaac is currently in Drakelundh.



      Ethan is in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





      Current time interval: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous sets off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance.



      Question: Where is Aldous?
      Answer: Aldous is in Ignisvallis.



      Question: What is Aldous trying to do?
      Answer: Aldous is trying to convince Noah of the necessity of an alliance.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Aldous's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Aldous arrives at the village center and sees Noah tending to his crops.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: The most likely outcome is that Noah will stop working and speak with Aldous.



      Aldous sets off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance.


      Because of that, The most likely outcome is that Noah will stop working and speak with Aldous.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Aldous did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.

      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Aldous into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Aldous said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. In Ignisvallis, welcoming rituals for visitors involve collaborative weaving, symbolizing the integration of new threads into the community fabric. Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage. In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough. Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          Current time: 1750-01-02 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

          Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is preparing to meet with Jacob to discuss a potential alliance between their villages to defend against barbarian raiders. Aldous is seeking the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, to ensure the success of the agreement.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.


          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can begin seeking out Noah and Isaac to discuss the potential alliance and gauge their support.

          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac immediately.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
