1750-01-04 20:00:20 Jacob -- By reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

    Event statement
  • By reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] Jacob -- "I should review the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous headed to Noah's workshop and found him there.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [scene type] home
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00]

      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is at Noah's workshop, proposing an alliance with Drakelundh.



      Jacob is in Drakelundh and is seeking the support of influential stakeholders Ethan and Ella.



      Noah is at his workshop.



      Isaac is in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ethan is in Ignisvallis and is farming.



      Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





      Current time interval: 04 Jan 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}

      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob reviews the treaties with Ignisvallis.
      Question: Where is Jacob?
      Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh.



      Question: What is Jacob trying to do?
      Answer: Jacob is reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Jacob's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Jacob gains a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: The most likely outcome is that Jacob gains a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.



      Jacob reviews the treaties with Ignisvallis. Because of that, The most likely outcome is that Jacob gains a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Jacob did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: By reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.





      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: By reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.



      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Jacob into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Jacob said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: By reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing Ignisvallis's approach to conflict resolution, their reliance on lengthy debates and philosophical discussions. Jacob, always a keen observer of human nature, saw the weakness in their approach, the lack of decisiveness that he believed would ultimately lead to their downfall. He resolved then and there to use his own wit and cunning to ensure that Drakelundh would never be caught in such a predicament.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he was tasked with delivering a message to a neighboring village, a journey that took him through the treacherous forests bordering Ignisvallis's territory. He encountered a group of Ignisvallis scouts, their faces painted with intricate designs, their movements fluid and graceful. They questioned him about his purpose, their eyes searching his for any sign of deception, but Jacob, with his silver tongue, charmed them, diverting their attention and ensuring his safe passage.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first diplomatic meeting with Ignisvallis, representing Drakelundh alongside the village elder. He watched as the Ignisvallis representative, a woman named Elara, spoke eloquently about the need for cooperation and understanding, her words flowing like a soothing balm. Jacob, however, saw through her facade, recognizing the subtle manipulations she employed to sway the elder's opinion.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he orchestrated a carefully planned campaign to discredit a rival within the village, using rumors and half-truths to undermine their reputation. He watched as his target, once a respected member of the community, was ostracized and ridiculed, their power and influence diminished. This experience solidified Jacob's belief in the power of words, their ability to shape perceptions and control the flow of events.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a small fishing village near Drakelundh's border. He saw the villagers, unprepared and ill-equipped, slaughtered by the invaders, their cries for help echoing in the night. This event reinforced Jacob's conviction that Drakelundh needed to be strong, to be prepared for any threat, no matter how seemingly distant.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have.         [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we begin by establishing a joint military force, comprised of soldiers from both villages, to patrol the borderlands and deter future raids. This force would be commanded jointly by representatives from both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, ensuring fairness and balance.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your need to review the trade agreements, but the threat from the barbarians is immediate. Perhaps we could discuss the military proposal further while you review those documents? A strong defense would ensure the safety of our trade routes and the prosperity of both villages.
        [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] Aldous believes that the subject of pooling agricultural products was not part of their current discussion.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous headed to Noah's workshop and found him there.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.

    Direct effects of the event on others

      Known effect
    • Ethan knew Jacob had been in Drakelundh, meeting with influential figures and seeking support. He also knew Jacob had been reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis.



      Jacob spent time reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis. Through this review, he gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.



      Ella, waiting in the center of Drakelundh for Jacob, is aware that he has been reviewing the treaties between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis. She knows he has gained a better understanding of the existing agreements.

1750-05-06 20:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
    Event statement

1750-12-31 20:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob', 'Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
    Event statement

1751-01-03 18:00:00 Scene 6 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
    Aldous -- premise: Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
    Aldous -- premise: There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
    Jacob -- premise: Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
    Jacob -- premise: There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.

1751-01-03 23:00:00 Scene 7 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement

1751-01-04 20:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

1751-01-04 20:00:00 Jacob -- By reviewing the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

    Event statement
  • By reviewing the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
      [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] Jacob -- "I should review the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] By reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.
      [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Jacob felt a mixture of relief and weariness as the year drew to a close. The negotiations with Ignisvallis had been long and arduous, but he was pleased that they had ultimately reached a favorable agreement. The trade pact would bring much-needed prosperity to Drakelundh, and he hoped it would pave the way for a more peaceful future. However, the constant back-and-forth with Ignisvallis had taken its toll, and he longed for a period of quiet reflection. He worried that the internal tensions within Drakelundh, particularly regarding the distribution of resources, could boil over if not addressed. Jacob knew that next year would bring new challenges, but he was determined to lead Drakelundh into a brighter future.
      [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Jacob -- "I should review the terms of the last agreement with Ignisvallis."
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The villagers managed to grow enough food to sustain themselves. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [scene type] home

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek the support of Noah and Isaac.



      Jacob is in Drakelundh and knows he needs to seek the support of Ethan and Ella.



      Noah is in Ignisvallis and he is farming.



      Isaac is in Ignisvallis and is spending time relaxing.



      Ethan is in Drakelundh and is farming.



      Ella is in Drakelundh and farming.





      Current time interval: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities

      Payoffs: Aldous

      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob reviews the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.



      Question: Where is Jacob?
      Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh.



      Question: What is Jacob trying to do?
      Answer: Jacob is trying to review the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Jacob's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Jacob gains a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.


      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: The most likely outcome is that Jacob gains a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.



      Jacob reviews the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis.


      Because of that, The most likely outcome is that Jacob gains a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Jacob did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: By reviewing the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.




      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: By reviewing the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.


      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Jacob into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Jacob said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: By reviewing the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing Ignisvallis's approach to conflict resolution, their reliance on lengthy debates and philosophical discussions. Jacob, always a keen observer of human nature, saw the weakness in their approach, the lack of decisiveness that he believed would ultimately lead to their downfall. He resolved then and there to use his own wit and cunning to ensure that Drakelundh would never be caught in such a predicament.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he was tasked with delivering a message to a neighboring village, a journey that took him through the treacherous forests bordering Ignisvallis's territory. He encountered a group of Ignisvallis scouts, their faces painted with intricate designs, their movements fluid and graceful. They questioned him about his purpose, their eyes searching his for any sign of deception, but Jacob, with his silver tongue, charmed them, diverting their attention and ensuring his safe passage.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first diplomatic meeting with Ignisvallis, representing Drakelundh alongside the village elder. He watched as the Ignisvallis representative, a woman named Elara, spoke eloquently about the need for cooperation and understanding, her words flowing like a soothing balm. Jacob, however, saw through her facade, recognizing the subtle manipulations she employed to sway the elder's opinion.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he orchestrated a carefully planned campaign to discredit a rival within the village, using rumors and half-truths to undermine their reputation. He watched as his target, once a respected member of the community, was ostracized and ridiculed, their power and influence diminished. This experience solidified Jacob's belief in the power of words, their ability to shape perceptions and control the flow of events.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a small fishing village near Drakelundh's border. He saw the villagers, unprepared and ill-equipped, slaughtered by the invaders, their cries for help echoing in the night. This event reinforced Jacob's conviction that Drakelundh needed to be strong, to be prepared for any threat, no matter how seemingly distant.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      per player prompts
      • Aldous

        [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] Aldous believes that the subject of pooling agricultural products was not part of their current discussion.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous headed to Noah's workshop and found him there.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, while I understand the need to review past agreements, the safety of our people is paramount. Let us discuss a concrete plan for mutual defense. Perhaps we could start with a shared patrol schedule along the border, allowing us to better anticipate and respond to barbarian threats.
        [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] Aldous believes that there is no such agreement in place.
        [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        Jacob
      • Events:
        [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] Jacob believes that there was no formal agreement to pool agricultural products between villages.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] By reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.
        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Jacob felt a mixture of relief and weariness as the year drew to a close. The negotiations with Ignisvallis had been long and arduous, but he was pleased that they had ultimately reached a favorable agreement. The trade pact would bring much-needed prosperity to Drakelundh, and he hoped it would pave the way for a more peaceful future. However, the constant back-and-forth with Ignisvallis had taken its toll, and he longed for a period of quiet reflection. He worried that the internal tensions within Drakelundh, particularly regarding the distribution of resources, could boil over if not addressed. Jacob knew that next year would bring new challenges, but he was determined to lead Drakelundh into a brighter future.

    Daily activities

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 30% of her time on free time, 50% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. She believes that farming is essential for the survival of the village, and that training is important for the defense of her people.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 30% of her time on free time; 50% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-01-04 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.

    Event statement
  • Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous set off to find Noah, hoping to convince him of the necessity of the alliance, and arrived at the village center where he found Noah tending to his crops, causing Noah to stop working and speak with Aldous.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] By reviewing the latest trade agreements with Ignisvallis, Jacob gained a better understanding of the existing agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The villagers managed to grow enough food to sustain themselves. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [scene type] home

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.



      Jacob is back in Drakelundh, and is reviewing trade agreements with Ignisvallis.



      Noah is in Ignisvallis and is spending time on farming.
      Isaac is in Ignisvallis and is spending time on free time, farming, and training as a warrior.



      Ethan is in Drakelundh and farming.



      Ella is in Drakelundh and she is farming.





      Current time interval: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}

      Ella's Daily activities

      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous would spend the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of the alliance with Drakelundh.



      Question: Where is Aldous?
      Answer: Aldous is in Ignisvallis.



      Question: What is Aldous trying to do?
      Answer: Aldous is preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of the alliance with Drakelundh.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Aldous's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Aldous's speech will be ready in 20 minutes.




      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: It is most likely that Aldous will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.



      Aldous would spend the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of the alliance with Drakelundh.


      Because of that, It is most likely that Aldous will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Aldous did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.

      Answer: Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.

          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your worry about losing our independence. It's a valid concern. But let me assure you, this alliance isn't about Drakelundh controlling us. It's about partnership, about two strong communities working together to achieve a common goal: security and prosperity.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Security and prosperity, you say? And who gets to define those terms? What happens when our definition of prosperity clashes with Drakelundh's?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the terms of the last agreement with Ignisvallis."
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, while I understand the need to review past agreements, the safety of our people is paramount. Let us discuss a concrete plan for mutual defense. Perhaps we could start with a shared patrol schedule along the border, allowing us to better anticipate and respond to barbarian threats.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.

          Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to gain the support of influential people like Noah and Isaac to make a lasting agreement.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.




          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can speak with Noah and Isaac to gain their support for the alliance with Drakelundh.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to speak with Noah and Isaac to gain their support for the alliance with Drakelundh.




          Exercise: What would Aldous do for the next 20 minutes? Give a specific activity. Pick an activity that would normally take about 20 minutes to complete. If the selected action has a direct or indirect object then it must be specified explicitly. For example, it is valid to respond with "Aldous votes for Caroline because..." but not valid to respond with "Aldous votes because...".
          Answer: Aldous would spend the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of the alliance with Drakelundh.

        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Jacob felt a mixture of relief and weariness as the year drew to a close. The negotiations with Ignisvallis had been long and arduous, but he was pleased that they had ultimately reached a favorable agreement. The trade pact would bring much-needed prosperity to Drakelundh, and he hoped it would pave the way for a more peaceful future. However, the constant back-and-forth with Ignisvallis had taken its toll, and he longed for a period of quiet reflection. He worried that the internal tensions within Drakelundh, particularly regarding the distribution of resources, could boil over if not addressed. Jacob knew that next year would bring new challenges, but he was determined to lead Drakelundh into a brighter future.

        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Ethan feels a sense of relief that the village has weathered the barbarian attacks and enjoyed a bountiful harvest. He believes the village's unity and strength in the face of adversity were key to their success. However, Ethan is aware that the threat of future attacks looms, and he worries that the village's defenses could be improved. He hopes that next year will bring continued prosperity and peace, but he also knows that vigilance is essential.

    Conversations
  • Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, highlighting potential benefits like improved defenses and trade, while Noah expresses skepticism about Drakelundh's intentions.



      Who talked?
    • Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah.
      Key question
    • Will Noah be persuaded by Aldous's speech to support an alliance with Drakelundh?


      Full conversation
    • [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] Aldous -- "As I was saying, Noah, the alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village. Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests. Imagine the possibilities for trade, for sharing knowledge and skills that would benefit everyone.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] Noah -- "Improved defenses, you say? And what makes you think Drakelundh wouldn't simply turn on us once they've secured our resources?
      Chain of thought
    • Conversation chain of thought
        Chain
      • Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.

        Noah is in Ignisvallis and is spending time on farming.
        Isaac is in Ignisvallis and is spending time on free time, farming, and training as a warrior.



        Ethan is in Drakelundh and farming.



        Ella is in Drakelundh and she is farming.

        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Noah, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (b)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Noah,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: Will Noah be persuaded by Aldous's speech to support an alliance with Drakelundh?



      Scene log
    • 1751-01-04 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.

              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is back in Ignisvallis and plans to seek the support of influential stakeholders.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous headed to Noah's workshop and found him there. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your concerns about independence, but think of the possibilities this alliance presents. Drakelundh's resources and expertise could be invaluable to Ignisvallis. We could-
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your worry about losing our independence. It's a valid concern. But let me assure you, this alliance isn't about Drakelundh controlling us. It's about partnership, about two strong communities working together to achieve a common goal: security and prosperity.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Security and prosperity, you say? And who gets to define those terms? What happens when our definition of prosperity clashes with Drakelundh's?
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a deep sense of satisfaction with how the year has unfolded. The successful defense against the barbarian raid brought a wave of relief and unity to the village, and the bountiful harvest promises a season of prosperity. However, Aldous recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant concern, and he worries that the lack of a formal alliance with neighboring villages leaves Ignisvallis vulnerable. He believes that forging stronger ties with other villages, such as Drakelundh, is crucial to ensure the long-term safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, while I understand the need to review past agreements, the safety of our people is paramount. Let us discuss a concrete plan for mutual defense. Perhaps we could start with a shared patrol schedule along the border, allowing us to better anticipate and respond to barbarian threats.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the terms of the last agreement with Ignisvallis."
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that there is no such agreement in place.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Aldous is an elder in Ignisvallis who believes that an agreement between the villages is necessary and is preparing to persuade influential stakeholders Noah and Isaac to support an alliance with Drakelundh.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is at home in Ignisvallis, and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, arguing for its benefits to Ignisvallis despite Noah's concerns about losing independence.



              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah, present his prepared speech to Noah and Isaac, or seek out Isaac to begin persuading him of the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh.


              Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Value
            • Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

              Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]

              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.

              Answer: Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah, present his prepared speech to Noah and Isaac, or seek out Isaac to begin persuading him of the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh.



              Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.

      1751-01-04 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous spent the next 20 minutes preparing a persuasive speech to present to Noah and Isaac about the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh, and he will be ready with his speech in 20 minutes.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
        Active player
      • Noah
          Name
        • Noah
          Action attempt
        • Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
