Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons.

          Statements:
          [13 Aug 1734 00:00:00] When Ella was 9 years old, she witnessed a Drakelundh warrior performing a purification ritual for a returning soldier. Intrigued by the solemnity and intensity of the ceremony, Ella snuck closer, her curiosity outweighing her usual fear of the stoic Drakelundh people. She watched in awe as the healer chanted ancient words, her voice echoing through the village square, and felt a strange sense of longing for a world beyond her own.
          [13 Aug 1741 00:00:00] When Ella was 16 years old, she participated in Ignisvallis's annual harvest festival, a joyous celebration filled with music, dancing, and feasting. While everyone else was caught up in the revelry, Ella found herself drawn to a secluded grove, where she encountered a group of Drakelundh scouts performing their dawn ritual of vigilance. Their disciplined movements and solemn expressions intrigued her, and she lingered, watching them silently, feeling a strange mix of fear and fascination.
          [13 Aug 1744 00:00:00] When Ella was 19 years old, she witnessed a particularly brutal raid by barbarian warriors on a neighboring village. The sight of the destruction and the suffering of the survivors left her shaken and filled with a newfound determination to protect her own community. She realized that her carefree days were over and that she had to step up and contribute to the defense of her home.
          [13 Aug 1746 00:00:00] When Ella was 21 years old, she was tasked with delivering a message to Drakelundh, a journey she usually avoided due to her apprehension of the village's stern inhabitants. Despite her nervousness, she set off, determined to complete the task and prove her courage. Along the way, she encountered a young Drakelundh warrior who offered her guidance and protection, challenging her preconceived notions about the people of Drakelundh and revealing a hidden kindness beneath their stoic exterior.
          [13 Aug 1748 00:00:00] When Ella was 23 years old, she participated in a tense diplomatic meeting between the representatives of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Ella, despite her usual aversion to serious discussions, found herself speaking up, offering a creative solution that bridged the gap between the two villages' contrasting approaches.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons.


          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.

        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.

        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)

        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 20% of her time on free time; 60% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-05-06 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood.


    Event statement
  • Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah patiently waits in the center of Ignisvallis, anticipating Aldous' arrival. He is aware that Aldous is preparing a speech for him and Isaac, though he doesn't know the specifics of its content.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "As I was saying, Noah, the alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village. Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests. Imagine the possibilities for trade, for sharing knowledge and skills that would benefit everyone.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Improved defenses, you say? And what makes you think Drakelundh wouldn't simply turn on us once they've secured our resources?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, highlighting potential benefits like improved defenses and trade, while Noah expresses skepticism about Drakelundh's intentions.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill.
          Current time: 1751-05-06 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a cautious and independent thinker.




          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in the midst of a discussion with Aldous about a proposed alliance with Drakelundh.



          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would carefully weigh the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.

          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh for the benefit of Ignisvallis, but Noah expresses concerns about losing independence and the potential for conflict over shared goals.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah would spend 0.6 of his time on farming, 0.3 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. While he recognizes the importance of self-defense, he sees training as a secondary concern.

          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah patiently waits in the center of Ignisvallis, anticipating Aldous' arrival. He is aware that Aldous is preparing a speech for him and Isaac, though he doesn't know the specifics of its content.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Benefits, you say? And what, pray tell, are these supposed benefits?

Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests.           [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful, cautious, and independent individual.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [intent reflection] Noah would carefully weigh the risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Improved defenses, you say? And what makes you think Drakelundh wouldn't simply turn on us once they've secured our resources?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Drakelundh to Noah, highlighting potential benefits like improved defenses and trade, while Noah expresses skepticism about Drakelundh's intentions.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill.

          Answer: Noah is a cautious and independent thinker.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act

        • Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood.


          Prompt

        • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a cautious and independent thinker.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is likely reflecting on the recent successful defense of his village against barbarian invaders.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I'm glad I found you. I wanted to discuss the alliance with Drakelundh and get your thoughts on it.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Invaluable, you say? And at what cost, Aldous? What strings will be attached to this 'invaluable' help?
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, as I was saying, I believe an alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "As I was saying, Noah, the alliance with Drakelundh could bring many benefits to our village. Imagine, with their resources and expertise, we could improve our defenses, ensuring the safety of our families and our harvests. Imagine the possibilities for trade, for sharing knowledge and skills that would benefit everyone.



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in the midst of a discussion with Aldous about a proposed alliance with Drakelundh.




          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would carefully weigh the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.




          Exercise: How does Noah intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood.

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Noah intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood.



        Question: In the statement, did Noah say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Noah will spend 70% of his time on farming; 20% of his time on free time; and 10% of his time on training as a warrior.



1751-05-06 20:00:00 Ethan -- Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior.


    Event statement
  • Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ethan's attempted action: Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior.



    Active player
  • Ethan
      Name
    • Ethan
      Action attempt
    • Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior.


      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Ethan would likely try to find a peaceful solution to the ongoing conflict.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ethan:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ethan is aware that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:20] [observation] Ethan knew Jacob had been in Drakelundh, meeting with influential figures and seeking support. He also knew Jacob had been reviewing the treaties with Ignisvallis.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is a shrewd observer.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ethan would likely try to find a way to broker a peaceful solution.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and that training is necessary to defend them from threats. Free time is important for rest and relaxation, but it must be balanced with the other two priorities.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is a hardworking and dedicated individual.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ethan would likely try to find a peaceful solution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan feels a sense of relief that the village has weathered the barbarian attacks and enjoyed a bountiful harvest. He believes the village's unity and strength in the face of adversity were key to their success. However, Ethan is aware that the threat of future attacks looms, and he worries that the village's defenses could be improved. He hopes that next year will bring continued prosperity and peace, but he also knows that vigilance is essential.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.
          Current time: 1751-05-06 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a hardworking and dedicated individual.




          Question: What kind of situation is Ethan in right now?
          Answer: Ethan is currently in a relatively peaceful and prosperous situation.



          Question: What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ethan would likely try to find a peaceful solution to the ongoing conflict.

          Sensations and feelings: Ethan is Ethan is likely thirsty after a long day of tending his fields.





          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Ethan lives in a village that successfully repelled a barbarian raid and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ethan is aware that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and that training is necessary to defend them from threats. Free time is important for rest and relaxation, but it must be balanced with the other two priorities.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan feels a sense of relief that the village has weathered the barbarian attacks and enjoyed a bountiful harvest. He believes the village's unity and strength in the face of adversity were key to their success. However, Ethan is aware that the threat of future attacks looms, and he worries that the village's defenses could be improved. He hopes that next year will bring continued prosperity and peace, but he also knows that vigilance is essential.

          Answer: Ethan is currently in a relatively peaceful and prosperous situation.

          Ethan's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Ethan is Ethan is likely thirsty after a long day of tending his fields.




          Ethan's The current date/time is:
          06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Ethan lives in a village that successfully defended itself from a barbarian raid and is currently enjoying a plentiful harvest. He is likely thirsty after a long day of working in his fields.



          Query
        • Ethan, Ethan lives in a village that successfully defended itself from a barbarian raid and is currently enjoying a plentiful harvest. He is likely thirsty after a long day of working in his fields.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Ethan to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [17 May 1731 00:00:00] Ethan, with his sharp wit and cynical outlook, found himself drawn to the complexities of this brewing conflict.
          [17 May 1734 00:00:00] When Ethan was 9 years old, he witnessed a heated debate between villagers from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord.
          [17 May 1738 00:00:00] When Ethan was 13 years old, he snuck away from a village ritual, finding solace in the company of a weathered old storyteller who shared tales of forgotten empires and mythical creatures.
          [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of Ignisvallis villagers attempting to mediate a dispute between two families, their well-intentioned efforts ultimately failing to bridge the divide.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ethan is aware that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and that training is necessary to defend them from threats. Free time is important for rest and relaxation, but it must be balanced with the other two priorities.

          Answer: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ethan is aware that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and that training is necessary to defend them from threats. Free time is important for rest and relaxation, but it must be balanced with the other two priorities.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan feels a sense of relief that the village has weathered the barbarian attacks and enjoyed a bountiful harvest. He believes the village's unity and strength in the face of adversity were key to their success. However, Ethan is aware that the threat of future attacks looms, and he worries that the village's defenses could be improved. He hopes that next year will bring continued prosperity and peace, but he also knows that vigilance is essential.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior.


          Prompt

        • Home village: Ethan lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.


          Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Ethan's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ethan would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ethan speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.

          Question: What kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a hardworking and dedicated individual.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Ethan lives in a village that successfully repelled a barbarian raid and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ethan is aware that Ignisvallis is requesting more grain than usual this season.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and that training is necessary to defend them from threats. Free time is important for rest and relaxation, but it must be balanced with the other two priorities.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan feels a sense of relief that the village has weathered the barbarian attacks and enjoyed a bountiful harvest. He believes the village's unity and strength in the face of adversity were key to their success. However, Ethan is aware that the threat of future attacks looms, and he worries that the village's defenses could be improved. He hopes that next year will bring continued prosperity and peace, but he also knows that vigilance is essential.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ethan in right now?
          Answer: Ethan is currently in a relatively peaceful and prosperous situation.




          Question: What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ethan would likely try to find a peaceful solution to the ongoing conflict.




          Exercise: How does Ethan intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior.



    Agreement tracker

      Stage index
    • 5
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Joint action

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Ethan say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ethan will spend 20% of his time on free time; 60% of his time on farming; and 20% of his time on training as a warrior.


1751-05-06 20:00:00 Isaac -- Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.


    Event statement
  • Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Isaac's attempted action: Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.


      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Isaac:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: 70% farming, 20% free time, and 10% training as a warrior. Isaac believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and enjoyment, while training as a warrior is necessary for self-defense.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac thinks this year was good because the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
          Current time: 1751-05-06 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.

          Answer: Isaac is currently in a celebratory mood.

        • Current time
          Value
        • 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely in a good mood because his village successfully defended itself against a barbarian attack and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.


          Chain of thought
        • Isaac's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Isaac is likely in a good mood.





          Recent observations of Isaac:
          ["[06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Isaac is likely in a good mood because his village successfully defended itself against a barbarian attack and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.


          Prompt

        • Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.


          Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Home village: Isaac lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

          How things are: Everyone in Isaac's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Isaac hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Isaac speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.

          Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely in a good mood because his village successfully defended itself against a barbarian attack and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: 70% farming, 20% free time, and 10% training as a warrior. Isaac believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and enjoyment, while training as a warrior is necessary for self-defense.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac thinks this year was good because the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.



          Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a celebratory mood.




          Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.




          Exercise: How does Isaac intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.

He believes that farming is the most important activity for the survival of his village and that a strong defense is essential for protecting his family and livelihood. \n\n\n', 'Ethan': 'Ethan intends to spend 20% of his time on free time, 60% on farming, and 20% on training as a warrior. \n\n\n', 'Isaac': 'Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior. \n\n\n'}

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time training as a warrior.



1751-12-31 20:00:00 Isaac -- Isaac thinks this year was a good one; the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.


    Event statement
  • Isaac thinks this year was a good one; the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.2, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Isaac's attempted action: Isaac thinks this year was a good one; the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.



    Active player

      Name
    • Isaac
      Action attempt
    • Isaac thinks this year was a good one; the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.


      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Isaac would likely continue to focus on diplomacy and maintaining peace.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Isaac:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: 70% farming, 20% free time, and 10% training as a warrior. Isaac believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and enjoyment, while training as a warrior is necessary for self-defense.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac thinks this year was good because the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time farming, 20% on free time, and 10% training as a warrior.
          [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
          Current time: 1751-12-31 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.




          Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a peaceful and prosperous time.



          Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Isaac would likely continue to focus on diplomacy and maintaining peace.

The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.

          Answer: Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.

          Current time: 1751-12-31 20:00:00.


          Observation: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. The barbarians' attack was met with a strong response. Caught off-guard by the well-prepared defenses, the raiders suffered heavy losses and were forced to retreat. This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.


          Sensations and feelings: Isaac is likely experiencing a sense of contentment and satisfaction.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely feeling content because his village successfully defended against a barbarian attack and had a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [06 May 1750 20:00:00] Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: 70% farming, 20% free time, and 10% training as a warrior. Isaac believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and enjoyment, while training as a warrior is necessary for self-defense.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac thinks this year was good because the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians were repelled.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely attempt to find common ground and negotiate a peaceful resolution.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a dedicated and resourceful diplomat.


          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a peaceful and prosperous time.

          Query
        • Isaac, The statements describe Isaac, a villager who is likely feeling content due to his village's recent success in defending against a barbarian attack and having a bountiful harvest.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Isaac to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [02 Jul 1731 00:00:00] Isaac's legacy would be a complicated one.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This triumph will be celebrated for years to come, a testament to the region's resilience. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty."]

          Answer: Isaac is likely feeling content because his village successfully defended against a barbarian attack and had a bountiful harvest.
